channel.description: Navigate here for the the final release of Julia: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,664842.0.html

item.dc:creator: @Death_Style Death Style
item.description:
@Death_Style wrote:

people send mac addresses on login? anyone with a packet editor could change that

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

sk8rdude461:

What’s in the final? Just improved features or what?

[ul][li]Search added.[/li]
[li]Added themes to the ui.[/li]
[li]Added possibility for level requirements for shops.[/li]
[li]Theme updating for all frames added.[/li]
[li]Can’t open multiple instances of the same frame anymore, the open one will jump to the front instead.[/li]
[li]Reworked starter editor.[/li]
[li]Optimized list readability.[/li]
[li]Optimized the player manager + fixed a few bugs[/li]
[li]Added scrollpanes to lists.[/li]
[li]Optimized price editor. + Bugfix[/li]
[li]Data importer also supports .txt files (for PI prizes)[/li]
[li]Added points support to shops.
(A way to obtain them would require content editing so it’s kinda useless tbh, didn’t think it through.)[/li]
[li]Fixed a bug in item definition editor.[/li][/ul]

I pretty much reached all the goals I had for this project so it will be the final version.
Though I kinda got the hang of the project and plan on reworking or getting another base,
and rewrite the base to expand the possibilities of editors to manipulate much more content (e.g. for the points).
But that will not be for very soon as it will require more work and I have less time atm.

[quote=“arham 4, post:39, topic:545704”]False. You could send that data upon login client-sided. Alot of people do this in 718+.

InetAddress inet; inet = InetAddress.getLocalHost(); NetworkInterface network = NetworkInterface.getByInetAddress(inet); int mac = ByteBuffer.wrap(network.getHardwareAddress()).getInt(); stream.writeString(String.valueOf(mac), -1);[/quote]
:palm: Of course you can make the client send it.
But it’s impossible for the server to get it through the connection.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:17, topic:545704”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=664587.msg4443202#msg4443202 date=1407601928]

Jesus, I love that little GUI you made! However is their a way using that to give a player Vote points? I love that GUI though amazing.
Edit: Also a command to find your coords.

Yeah once I added shops I will handle vote/pk points and stuff as well.
And for coords I think just doing ::pos should work in game unless I accidently removed it.

Because of you I had to start working on my server’s GUI.
It’s probably going to look more complex and have more bells and whistles. But then again mine isn’t for a release.
[spoiler=My console so far]
[/spoiler]
[/quote]
Using eclipse windowbuilder?
Btw, you do know that a MAC adress only works local right? You can never obtain the MAC from somebody else not on your local network.[/quote]
False. You could send that data upon login client-sided. Alot of people do this in 718+.

InetAddress inet; inet = InetAddress.getLocalHost(); NetworkInterface network = NetworkInterface.getByInetAddress(inet); int mac = ByteBuffer.wrap(network.getHardwareAddress()).getInt(); stream.writeString(String.valueOf(mac), -1);

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:37, topic:545704”][quote author=BrandonRSPS link=topic=664587.msg4444310#msg4444310 date=1408008907]

that’s kind of you to give us a source with 100 errors :palm:

A 100 error is a quite simple fix.

The purpose of this project is creating your own base as beginner as simple as possible.
There are a whole bunch of editors (see media and features) that make modifying this server
to your liking very easy [u]WITHOUT touching a single line of actual java code.

[/quote]
Indeed, It’s fixed in the beta version, it’s because I didn’t edit the batches as I use an IDE.
But don’t bother as I’m going to release the final version in a few hours.[/quote]
What’s in the final? Just improved features or what?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[center][size=16pt]Beta version released.[/size][/center]

Updated this thread instead of making a new one.

[size=12pt]What has been updated in this(Beta) version?[/size]

[ul][li]New npc spawn editor.[/li]
[li]Shops editor.[/li]
[li]Data loader to import existing data.[/li]
[li]When changing server name, cache name automatically changes.[/li]
[li]Skill experience multiplier now actually works.[/li]
[li]Server messages and system update now work.[/li]
[li]Made lists scrollable.[/li]
[li]Npc spawn search function fixed.[/li]
[li]Item prizes editor modified.[/li]
[li]Npc definition editor fixed.[/li]
[li]Run batch fixed which was what gave some people errors.[/li][/ul]

Downloads:
Source: http://www.mediafire.com/download/9ayygdwcwyi14v5/Julie_Server_[Beta_version].rar

Client and cache is the same as the alpha release,
so if you’re just updating to the beta version you do not have to redownload these.

Client: http://www.mediafire.com/download/tu1maiy806xi9di/A_Julia_Client.rar
Cache: http://www.mediafire.com/download/nfmrfifv2pz3767/Julia_cache.rar

Read full topic

You can find all of them here.
Here are the direct links for those that don’t feel like going on my website:

Full version: http://rsps.canyourcode.com/Julia/Julia_Full.rar

item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“bloodm0on, post:28, topic:545704”][quote author=lord0ftacos link=topic=664587.msg4443512#msg4443512 date=1407718268]

Wow, nice job :). This will help a lot of new people. Love the GUI, download isn’t working.

I’ll be adding onto this, my friend needed help with a server, so this is what I’ll give him so he can learn :).

I don’t get it, you’re the third person saying the download doesn’t work while it works perfectly for me

Did you get the screenshot? I have no idea why its giving me that error. Upload using mediafire maybe?


[/quote]

I get this same exact error… :/[/quote]
I will post mirrors.

LeEndeavor:

Thanks a ton for this. I’ve been wanting to make a private server for quite some time. Sadly, I don’t know any code, but I am starting to learn. I downloaded the client, alpha, and cache. I even updated all the .bat files with my java version. I got the server running, but when I go to open the client it gets to “requesting title screen” before going into a loop of the same error. Any help?

Did you put the cache in the c:\ drive of your computer?
Also if you changed the name of the server int the client properties file, you have to rename the cache as well. yourname_cache

MIRRORS:
Compact version: http://www.mediafire.com/download/wuvoalo587o0793/Julia_Server.rar
Full version: http://www.mediafire.com/download/yt62ed12l1td0dx/Julia_Alpha_version.rar
Client: http://www.mediafire.com/download/tu1maiy806xi9di/A_Julia_Client.rar
Cache: http://www.mediafire.com/download/nfmrfifv2pz3767/Julia_cache.rar

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:22, topic:545704”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=664587.msg4443391#msg4443391 date=1407687433]

Jesus, I love that little GUI you made! However is their a way using that to give a player Vote points? I love that GUI though amazing.
Edit: Also a command to find your coords.

Yeah once I added shops I will handle vote/pk points and stuff as well.
And for coords I think just doing ::pos should work in game unless I accidently removed it.

Because of you I had to start working on my server’s GUI.
It’s probably going to look more complex and have more bells and whistles. But then again mine isn’t for a release.
[spoiler=My console so far]
[/spoiler]

Using eclipse windowbuilder?
Btw, you do know that a MAC adress only works local right? You can never obtain the MAC from somebody else not on your local network.

Yeah I wanted to try it out again. I typically used Netbeans’ and they’re rather identical.
And as for the MAC address, you can get someone elses MAC…
Proof:

pjstr(60-A4-4C-58-6B-37,)

lol they requested my physical address before i was disconnected.

You can’t. A MAC can’t get past a router, read up on networking.
[/quote]
Then explain how someone requested her MAC?
Afaik searching “getting client MAC address java” pulls up a mixed set of results. Some say you can’t, others say you can and give you a solution.
I used the solution that worked for me. I haven’t seen any errors since I’ve had literally no one on but me so. (Kinda can’t test via another network).[/quote]
Maybe you’re making the client tell it’s mac and save it to send it to the server, but you can’t directly retrieve a mac from a connection.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:21, topic:545704”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=664587.msg4443221#msg4443221 date=1407609228]

Jesus, I love that little GUI you made! However is their a way using that to give a player Vote points? I love that GUI though amazing.
Edit: Also a command to find your coords.

Yeah once I added shops I will handle vote/pk points and stuff as well.
And for coords I think just doing ::pos should work in game unless I accidently removed it.

Because of you I had to start working on my server’s GUI.
It’s probably going to look more complex and have more bells and whistles. But then again mine isn’t for a release.
[spoiler=My console so far]
[/spoiler]

Using eclipse windowbuilder?
Btw, you do know that a MAC adress only works local right? You can never obtain the MAC from somebody else not on your local network.

Yeah I wanted to try it out again. I typically used Netbeans’ and they’re rather identical.
And as for the MAC address, you can get someone elses MAC…
Proof:

pjstr(60-A4-4C-58-6B-37,)

lol they requested my physical address before i was disconnected.

[/quote]
You can’t. A MAC can’t get past a router, read up on networking.[/quote]
Then explain how someone requested her MAC?
Afaik searching “getting client MAC address java” pulls up a mixed set of results. Some say you can’t, others say you can and give you a solution.
I used the solution that worked for me. I haven’t seen any errors since I’ve had literally no one on but me so. (Kinda can’t test via another network).

Read full topic

And as for the MAC address, you can get someone elses MAC…
Proof:

[quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=662316.msg4435295#msg4435295 date=1404893333]
pjstr(60-A4-4C-58-6B-37,)

lol they requested my physical address before i was disconnected.
[/quote][/quote]
You can’t. A MAC can’t get past a router, read up on networking.
